Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

@chuckatkins @danlipsa For environments that blacklist environment variables, specifically LD_LIBRARY_PATH, paraview needs a different way to set up the python link.

This can be reproduced using an environment similar to this:
```yaml
# This is a Spack Environment file.
# 
# It describes a set of packages to be installed, along with
# configuration settings.
spack:
  # add package specs to the `specs` list
  specs:
  - paraview
  - python
  packages:
    paraview:
      version: [5.9.0]
      variants: [+python3]
    openmpi:
      buildable: false
      externals:
      - spec: openmpi@2.1.6
        modules:
        - openmpi/2.1.6-gcc_8.3.0
  compilers:
  - compiler:
      spec: gcc@8.3.0
      paths:
        cc: /projects/opt/x86_64/gcc/8.3.0/bin/gcc
        cxx: /projects/opt/x86_64/gcc/8.3.0/bin/g++
        f77: /projects/opt/x86_64/gcc/8.3.0/bin/gfortran
        fc: /projects/opt/x86_64/gcc/8.3.0/bin/gfortran
      flags: {}
      operating_system: centos7
      target: x86_64
      modules: []
      environment: {}
      extra_rpaths: []
  view: false
  modules:
    tcl:
      all:
        filter:
          environment_blacklist: [LD_LIBRARY_PATH]
```

```console
$ spack concretize -f
$ spack install
$ spack env loads
$ source loads
$ module list
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:
  1) paraview-5.9.0-gcc-8.3.0-tkkmviq   2) python-3.8.7-gcc-8.3.0-35x4p2b
$ ldd `which pvpython` | grep python
	libpython3.8.so.1.0 => not found
$ pvpython
pvpython: error while loading shared libraries: libpython3.8.so.1.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->

title: Installation issue: ParaView is over-reliant on LD_LIBRARY_PATH for setting up python link
